;;美国总统乔·拜登在美国华盛顿戴维营度过周末后，亨特·拜登抵达麦克奈尔堡后走向车队，2023 年 7 月 4 日。路透社/朱莉娅·尼欣森/档案照片;
;

;总统乔·拜登的儿子亨特·拜登周一起诉美国国税局，指控其工作的举报人非法披露其纳税情况美国税务机构。

;

;这起诉讼向美国哥伦比亚特区地方法院提起，主要针对美国国税局特工加里·沙普利 (Gary Shapley) 和约瑟夫·齐格勒 (Joseph Ziegler) 在众议院长期调查期间接受媒体采访时发表的声明。共和党代表对小拜登的税收和商业交易进行调查。

;

;53 岁的亨特·拜登正处于政治漩涡的中心，众议院共和党人 ;对他的父亲发起弹劾调查;，重点关注他的商业行为与他父亲担任副总统期间的政策之间所谓的联系2009年至2017年担任总统。迄今为止，他们已提出;没有证据;表明老拜登从他儿子的生意中获利。白宫否认有任何不当行为。

;

;亨特·拜登;现任美国总统的第一个被刑事起诉的孩子;。检察官上周指控他三项罪名，涉及他在购买枪支时撒谎使用非法毒品。亨特·拜登和检察官早些时候就税收和枪支指控达成了认罪协议，但;它崩溃了;。

;

;周一的诉讼提到了沙普利、齐格勒及其律师的“超过 20 次全国电视转播且未经国会批准的采访和大量公开声明”亨特·拜登。沙普利和齐格勒作为举报人在国会作证，指控美国国税局对拜登税收的调查涉嫌政治干预。司法部否认有任何此类干预。

;

;“该诉讼涉及国税局员工、其代表和其他人决定无视自己的义务，反复故意公开披露和传播拜登先生受保护的纳税申报表诉讼中写道。

;

;拜登正在为每项未经授权披露其纳税申报信息、美国国税局的声明、该机构的数据安全计划寻求 1,000 美元的赔偿，出示与拜登税收和其他减免相关的文件。

;

;共和党领导的众议院司法委员会在社交媒体上发帖称该诉讼为“恐吓”。美国国税局没有立即回应置评请求。

;

;亨特·拜登上周还;在唐纳德·特朗普担任总统期间对一名前白宫助手提起诉讼;，指控该助手涉嫌发布令人尴尬的图片和电子邮件。

;<对弹劾调查欢呼雀跃的特朗普是第一位两次被弹劾的美国总统。参议院两次都宣判他无罪。特朗普今年还因四起刑事案件受到指控。

;;2022 年 5 月 26 日，格鲁吉亚第比利斯举行独立日庆祝活动，身着传统服装的男子站在格鲁吉亚国旗旁。 REUTERS/Irakli Gedenidze ;
;

;格鲁吉亚周一指责一名现为乌克兰情报机构工作的前内政副部长密谋煽动内乱，试图推翻第比利斯政府，在格鲁吉亚深化与俄罗斯的关系之际，考验了与乌克兰的关系。

;

;国家安全局表示，它一直在监视由乔治·洛特基帕尼泽 (Giorgi Lortkipanidze) 领导的一个组织。洛特基帕尼泽现任乌克兰军事情报局副局长，曾任强烈亲西方的格鲁吉亚政府副部长。

;

; “根据已确认和核实的信息，由乔治·洛特基帕尼泽制定的计划的实施将涉及乌克兰境内相当大的格鲁吉亚武装人员和一部分格鲁吉亚青年，他们受到有关各方的影响，他们的训练在波兰附近进行。 -乌克兰国家边境，”该部门在一份声明中表示。

;

;它没有提供确凿的证据，基辅或洛特基帕尼泽也没有立即发表评论。

;

;声明称，涉嫌策划者欧盟委员会主席乌苏拉·冯德莱恩周三表示，如果欧盟在 12 月中旬的欧盟峰会上最终未能授予该国候选人地位，该计划将缓解格鲁吉亚年轻人可能出现的挫败感。

;

;欧盟委员会主席乌苏拉·冯德莱恩周三表示，乌克兰、摩尔多瓦和西巴尔干国家的未来是“在我们的联盟中”，但;对格鲁吉亚更加谨慎;，欧盟官员称该国已在加入欧盟的道路上倒退。

;

;高加索共和国表示致力于加入去年，尽管乌克兰和摩尔多瓦获得了候选国地位，但欧盟仍被拒绝。

;

;当时，布鲁塞尔表示第比利斯必须减少政治两极分化并改善国家机构的运作。

;

;自乌克兰战争爆发以来，格鲁吉亚与欧洲的关系也受到影响，尽管格鲁吉亚民众非常支持基辅，但格鲁吉亚政府一直避免指责莫斯科。

;

;许多格鲁吉亚人对俄罗斯对格鲁吉亚分裂地区的支持感到不满。阿布哈兹和南奥塞梯以及格鲁吉亚人在为基辅而战的外国人中占有相当大的比例。

;

;尽管格鲁吉亚已向乌克兰运送了人道主义援助物资，但它拒绝对俄罗斯实施制裁，并于 5 月允许直航往返和乌克兰。自2019年以来首次受到其庞大邻国的攻击。<​​/p>;

;同月，伊拉克利·加里巴什维利总理将俄罗斯入侵乌克兰归咎于西方北约联盟的扩张。 12月，执政的格鲁吉亚梦想党主席表示，在乌克兰作战的格鲁吉亚公民可能会失去公民身份。

;

;乌克兰还批评格鲁吉亚当局监禁亲西方前总统米哈伊尔·萨哈什维利(Mikheil Saakhashvili)，他获得了乌克兰的主权。国籍。

;

;格鲁吉亚国家安全局将萨卡什维利的一名前保镖以及在乌克兰作战的格鲁吉亚部队指挥官列为涉嫌阴谋者之一。

;;文件照片：英国-伊朗环保主义者莫拉德·塔赫巴兹 (Morad Tahbaz) 和罗克珊·塔赫巴兹 (Roxanne Tahbaz) 在这张从社交媒体获得的文件图片中摆出姿势。 Roxanne Tahbaz/via REUTERS 注意编辑 - 此图片由第三方提供。强制信用./文件照片;
;

;周一，五名美国被拘留者乘坐 ;交换;在美国关押的五名伊朗人，这是宿敌之间达成的一项罕见协议，该协议还解冻了德黑兰 60 亿美元的资金。

;

;一架飞机一位了解此事的消息人士告诉路透社，在双方收到资金已转入多哈账户的确认后不久，卡塔尔就派出飞机将五名美国公民及其两名亲属带离德黑兰。

;

;一名美国官员称，与此同时，五名伊朗人中的两人抵达卡塔尔。三人选择不返回伊朗。

;

;经过在卡塔尔进行数月谈判后，该协议消除了一名主要;美国和伊朗之间的关系令人恼火;，美国将德黑兰称为恐怖主义赞助者，而伊朗则称华盛顿为“大撒旦”。

;

;但是他们在其他问题上仍然存在严重分歧，从伊朗核计划及其在该地区的影响到美国的制裁和美国在海湾的军事存在。

;

;美国政府高级官员表示，该协议并没有改变华盛顿的敌对关系与德黑兰，但就伊朗核计划进行外交的大门是敞开的。

;

;“如果我们看到机会，我们将探索它，但现在，我真的无话可说，”该官员表示，要求匿名。

;

;;五名美国人; 具有双重国籍的人将飞往多哈，然后前往美国，一位了解这一过程的伊朗官员表示，“他们身体状况良好”。

;

;伊朗外交部发言人纳赛尔·卡纳尼 (Nasser Kanaani) 表示，其中两人被释放的伊朗人将返回伊朗，而其中两人将应要求留在美国。他补充说，一名被拘留者将前往第三国与家人团聚。

;

;卡纳尼表示，2018 年美国加强对伊朗制裁后，这些资金被冻结在韩国，将于周一提供给德黑兰。根据;协议;，卡塔尔将确保现金用于卡塔尔是一个规模虽小但非常富有的海湾阿拉伯能源生产国，它一直在寻求提高其全球形象，去年举办了足球世界杯，并在国际舞台上发挥了作用。外交。这个逊尼派穆斯林国家拥有大型美国军事基地，但也与什叶派穆斯林伊朗建立了密切关系。

;

;多哈与坐在不同酒店的伊朗和美国谈判代表举行了至少八轮会谈，通过消息人士此前告诉路透社，这是一种穿梭外交。

;

;根据该协议转移伊朗资金引起了美国共和党人的批评，他们称民主党总统乔·拜登实际上是在为美国公民支付赎金。< /p>;

;白宫;为该协议辩护;。

;

;即将获释的美国双重公民包括 51 岁的 Siamak Namazi 和 59 岁的 Emad Sharqi，他们都是商人，以及 67 岁的环保人士、同时拥有英国国籍的 Morad Tahbaz。上个月，他们被从监狱释放并;软禁;。< /p>;

;第四名美国公民也被释放并被软禁，而第五名美国公民已经被软禁。他们的身份尚未披露。

;

;伊朗官员将美国释放的五名伊朗人命名为迈赫达德·莫因-安萨里 (Mehrdad Moin-Ansari)、卡姆比兹·阿塔尔-卡沙尼 (Kambiz Attar-Kashani)、礼萨·萨尔汉普尔-卡夫拉尼 (Reza Sarhangpour-Kafrani)、阿明·哈桑扎德 (Amin Hassanzadeh) 和卡维·阿弗拉西亚比 (Kaveh Afrasiabi)。两名伊朗官员此前曾表示，阿夫拉西亚比将留在美国，但没有提及其他人。

;

;自从共和党人唐纳德·特朗普让美国退出两国之间的核协议以来，华盛顿和德黑兰之间的关系一直处于紧张状态。 2018 年担任总统时，他与伊朗和全球大国进行了合作。此后，随着拜登为 2024 年美国大选做准备，达成另一项核协议几乎没有获得多少支持。

;

;作为该协议的第一步，华盛顿 ;放弃制裁;，允许将 60 亿美元的伊朗资金从韩国转移到卡塔尔。当华盛顿对德黑兰实施全面金融制裁时，这些资金在通常是伊朗最大石油客户之一的韩国被冻结，现金无法转移。

; Mon, 18 Sep 2023 22:55:03 +0800 US homebuilder confidence falls to lowest since April, says NAHBhttps://reuters.com/article/usa-economy-home-builders/us-homebuilder-confidence-falls-to-lowest-since-april-says-nahb-idUSKBN30O0WP

;;2021 年 6 月 3 日，美国加利福尼亚州 Valley Center 社区由 KB Home 建造的住宅单户住宅正在施工中。 路透社/Mike Blake/;
;

;9 月份美国房屋建筑商信心连续第二个月下降，乐观情绪降至 4 月份以来的最低水平，原因是高利率削弱了潜在买家的承受能力。

;<全国住宅建筑商协会/富国银行住宅建筑商信心指数从 8 月份的 50 降至本月的 45，当时建筑商信心自 12 月以来首次下降。乐观情绪的下降伴随着潜在买家流量的减少。

;

;信心低于路透调查显示经济学家的预期中位数为 50。

;

;“高NAHB 首席经济学家 Robert Dietz 表示：“抵押贷款利率显然正在损害建筑商信心和消费者需求，因为越来越多的买家选择推迟购房，直到长期利率下降。” “制定允许建筑商增加住房供应的政策是缓解国家住房负担能力危机和遏制住房通胀的最佳补救措施。”

;

;由于利率上升而阻碍房主出售房屋，随着新房建设需求的增加，住宅建筑商市场在 2023 年上半年显示出复苏的迹象。不过，最新数据表明经济复苏已步履蹒跚。

;

;自美联储于 2022 年 3 月开始加息以来，抵押贷款利率有所上升，自 8 月初以来一直保持在 7% 以上，为自 2022 年 3 月以来的最高水平。 2002 年。

;

;由于价格较低，建筑商 9 月份的销售预期下降，六个月房屋销售前景从上个月的 55 降至 49。 9 月份，32% 的建筑商降价，这是 2022 年 12 月以来的最高水平。

;;9 月 11 日，巴西总统路易斯·伊纳西奥·卢拉·达席尔瓦在印度新德里 G20 峰会后在一家酒店举行的新闻发布会上发表讲话，2023年。路透社/Anushree Fadnavis/资料图;
;

;巴西总统路易斯·伊纳西奥·卢拉·达席尔瓦自1月复职以来，已访问21个国家，会见了50多位国家元首，包括两位国王和教皇。

;

;这位周游世界的左翼领导人是第一位在周二在联合国大会上发表讲话的国家元首，迄今为止，他在第三个任期内将出国旅行列为优先事项，因为他努力恢复他的国家作为全球参与者的地位。

;

;“巴西回来了”，他在五大洲的演讲中重复道，这与他的前任雅伊尔·博尔索纳罗的极右政治立场所带来的日益孤立形成鲜明对比。

;

;但外交官和外交政策专家表示，卢拉远未恢复巴西在 2003 年至 2010 年前两届任期后所享有的“软实力”地位，当时巴西成为了巴西的代言人。正在崛起的南半球国家，同时保持独立于美国和中国的地位。

;

;这在一定程度上反映了这位 77 岁的巴西领导人现在所处的局势更加波涛汹涌，因为北京和华盛顿正在酝酿一场新的冷战，而乌克兰战事如火如荼。巴西也越来越依赖亚洲市场，其出口产品有一半是由亚洲市场购买的。仅巴西主要贸易伙伴中国就购买了巴西 37% 的农产品出口。

;

;“这是一个非常棘手的平衡行为，卢拉迄今为止尚未能找到正确的平衡，”Oliver Stuenkel 说道，圣保罗 FGV 智库国际关系副教授。 “现在巴西社会有一种看法，认为他比西方更倾向于中俄轴心。”

;

;周三，卢拉计划与美国总统乔·拜登会面，讨论气候危机。联合国大会间隙，重点关注巴西领导人的闪光点。

;

;卢拉帮助恢复了巴西在气候外交中的核心作用，领导了区域雨林峰会，吸引了全球捐款来保护亚马逊，并进行了全面改革大幅减少森林砍伐的政策。

;

;甚至在上任之前，卢拉就;去年 11 月在埃及举行的联合国气候变化会议上，我们像摇滚明星一样受到欢迎;。相比之下，截至 8 月份，他的政策已帮助巴西亚马逊;将巴西亚马逊地区的森林砍伐量减少了近一半;到去年前八个月，重建了巴西在气候谈判中的信誉。

;

;但他对乌克兰战争的评论 - 他在寻求促成和平协议时表示，双方都应对冲突负责- 激怒了美国和欧洲盟友，他们指责他人云亦云。

;

;卢拉喜欢即兴发表言论，有时会让事情变得更糟。

;

;在 20 国集团 (G20) 会议期间印度本月表示，如果俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔·普京参加明年在里约热内卢举行的峰会，他“不可能”被捕。当记者询问他巴西是否承诺执行国际刑事法院发出的逮捕令时，他;撤回了他的评论;，但建议巴西可以退出国际刑事法院。

;

;“有一些令人痛苦的时刻。整个俄罗斯-乌克兰问题是一个教训，前美国驻巴西大使、现任阿诺德波特公司高级国际政策顾问托马斯·香农 (Thomas Shannon) 说道。

;

;上个月在南非举行的金砖国家峰会上，主要新兴经济体集团扩大了成员规模，在中国的呼吁下，巴西获得了中国的支持，获得了它想要的联合国安理会常任理事国席位。但香农表示，这种情况不太可能很快发生。

;

;香农补充说，与北京的密切关系可能会使巴西与华盛顿的关系复杂化，包括获取关键技术的关系。

;

;在国内，卢拉并没有从拉丁美洲广泛的中左翼联盟中获得什么具体收获。南方共同市场贸易集团花了近半年的时间才;做出回应; 欧洲现在就贸易协议正式采取新立场;即将举行< /a>;.

; Mon, 18 Sep 2023 21:55:04 +0800 Libya floods: after a week, families haunted by fate of the missinghttps://reuters.com/article/libya-storm/a-week-after-floods-libyans-haunted-by-fate-of-the-missing-idUSKBN30O0GQ
;;2023-09-18T13:49:42Z;
;;
;;57-year-old Ayyad Salem described his family's ordeal during a flood that devastated swathes of the city, recalling the moment he was trapped in a water-filled room.;
;

;Sabreen Blil was on her hands and knees atop the rubble of her brother's house, the wind beating at her black robe as she clawed with her bare hands at the flattened masonry in hope of somehow digging to the family buried below.

;

;She recited their names as she wept.

;

;"Taym, Yazan, Luqman, Salmah, Tumador, Hakim and his wife. Oh my God. My family, where are you?" she wailed. "Oh God. Even just one - my God - just let me find even one body."

;

;A week after the flood that swept the centre of the city of Derna into the sea, families are still coping with the unbearable losses of their dead - and haunted by the unknown fates of the missing.

;

;The centre of Derna is a wasteland, with stray dogs standing listlessly on muddy mounds where buildings once stood. Other buildings still somehow stand precariously above bottom floors that were mostly washed away. The legs of a store mannequin in dusty trousers stick out of the rubble in a ruined shop-front.

;

;Dams above the city ;burst in a storm; a week ago, sending a huge torrent down a seasonal riverbed that runs through the centre of the city of 120,000 people.

;

;Thousands are dead and thousands more missing. Officials using different methodologies have given widely varying figures of the tolls so far; the mayor estimates more than 20,000 people were lost.

;

;The World Health Organization has confirmed 3,922 deaths.

;

;But Blil and other residents are mourning the uncounted thousands who are not on any confirmed list. She summons up a picture of her young nephew on her mobile phone, holding a kitten above his head in one outstretched hand.

;

;"They used to play here. They were sitting here. They used to go out to visit me and I used to visit them. Nothing is left. The floods took everything," Blil says. "Their toys, books, their father, their mother."

;

;Authorities have not yet given up on the possibility of finding people alive, Othman Abduljaleel, health minister in the administration that controls eastern Libya, told Reuters.

;

;"Hopes of finding survivors are fading, but we will continue efforts to search for any possible survivor," he said by phone.

;

;"Now efforts are focused on rescuing anyone and recovering bodies from under the rubble, especially at sea, with the participation of many divers and specialized rescue teams from countries."

;

;For Ahmed Ashour, 62, the fading hope of finding survivors has meant accepting that he will have to raise his orphaned 3-month-old granddaughter. His daughter is gone. His wife still hasn't accepted it.

;

;"Her mother is convinced that she is still alive. I am convinced that she is dead," he said.

;

;The roads into Derna were clogged on Monday with ambulances and trucks carrying in food, water, diapers, mattresses and other supplies.

;

;Men in white hazmat suits sprayed disinfectant mist from pumps mounted in the back of a pick-up truck and from hoses in backpacks, as authorities hoped to halt the spread of disease.

;

;"We are sanitising the streets, mosques, shelters, where displaced people are staying, mortuary refrigerators, the blighted streets and the bodies," said Akbar al-Qatani, head of the environment directorate based in Benghazi, eastern Libya's de facto capital.

;

;The International Rescue Committee charity said the flooding had left thousands of people without access to safe drinking water: "Contaminated water can lead to the spread of waterborne diseases, putting vulnerable populations, especially women and children, at increased risk."

;

;Western countries and regional states have sent teams of rescue workers and mobile hospitals. Five Greek rescue workers, including three members of the armed forces, were ;killed in a car crash; on Sunday.

;

;The recovery effort has been hampered by chaos in a nation that has been a failed state since a NATO-backed uprising that toppled Muammar Gaddafi in 2011.

;

;Derna is in the east, beyond the control of an internationally recognised government in the west, and until 2019 was held by a succession of Islamist militant groups including branches of al Qaeda and Islamic State.

;

;Residents say the threat to the city from the crumbling dams above it had been widely known, with projects to repair the dams ;stalled for more; than a decade. They also blame authorities for failing to evacuate residents in time.

;Five US detainees flew out of Iran on Monday in a ;swap; for five Iranians held in the US under a rare deal brokered by Qatar between the arch enemies that also unfroze $6 billion of Tehran's funds.

;

;A Qatari plane took off from Tehran carrying the five with two of their relatives, shortly after the US and Iran received confirmation that the funds had been transferred to accounts in Doha, a source briefed on the matter told Reuters.

;

;Iran's Press TV said two of the five Iranians to be released in the exchange had landed in Doha. There was no independent confirmation, though Iranian officials had said three of those to be freed by the US were not returning to Iran.

;

;The funds' release triggered an exchange sequence agreed after months of talks between the United States and Iran, who are at odds over Tehran's nuclear ambitions and other issues.

;

;The ;five Americans; with dual nationality are due to fly to Doha and then on to the US "They are in good health," an Iranian official briefed on the process said.

;

;Iran's Foreign ministry spokesperson Nasser Kanaani said two of the Iranians being released would return to Iran while two would stay in the US at their request. One detainee would join his family in a third country, he added.

;

;Kanaani said the funds, blocked in South Korea after US sanctions on Iran were hardened in 2018, would be available to Tehran on Monday. Under the ;deal;, Qatar will ensure the cash is spent on humanitarian goods and not items under US sanctions.

;

;The deal will remove a major ;irritant; between the US, which brands Tehran a state sponsor of terrorism, and Iran, which calls Washington the "Great Satan".

;

;But they remain deeply divided on other issues ranging from Iran's nuclear programme and its influence around the region to US sanctions and America's military presence in the Gulf.

;

;Qatar, a tiny but hugely wealthy Gulf Arab energy producer, has sought to raise its global profile, hosting the soccer World Cup last year and carving out a role in international diplomacy. The Sunni Muslim nation hosts a big US military base but has also forged close ties with Shi'ite Muslim Iran.

;

;Doha hosted at least eight rounds of talks with Iranian and US negotiators sitting in separate hotels, speaking via shuttle diplomacy, a source previously told Reuters.

;

;The transfer of Iran's funds under the agreement has drawn criticism from US Republicans who say President Joe Biden, a Democrat, is in effect paying a ransom for US citizens.

;

;The White House has ;defended; the deal.

;

;The US dual citizens to be released include Siamak Namazi, 51, and Emad Sharqi, 59, both businessmen, and Morad Tahbaz, 67, an environmentalist who also holds British nationality. They were released from prison and put under ;house arrest; last month.

;

;A fourth US citizen was also released into house arrest, while a fifth was already under house arrest. Their identities have not been disclosed.

;

;Iranian officials have named the five Iranians to be released by the US as Mehrdad Moin-Ansari, Kambiz Attar-Kashani, Reza Sarhangpour-Kafrani, Amin Hassanzadeh and Kaveh Afrasiabi. Two Iranian officials previously said that Afrasiabi would remain in the United States but had not mentioned others.

;

;Ties between Washington and Tehran have been boiling since Donald Trump, a Republican, pulled the US out of a nuclear deal between Iran and global powers when he was president in 2018. Reaching another nuclear deal has gained little traction since, as Biden prepares for the 2024 US election.

;

;As a first step in the deal, Washington ;waived sanctions; to allow the transfer of $6 billion in Iranian funds from South Korea to Qatar. The funds were blocked in South Korea, normally one of Iran's largest oil customers, when Washington imposed sweeping financial sanctions on Tehran and the cash could not be transferred.

;The United States and Iran, after months of Qatar-mediated talks, have struck a deal in which Tehran released five US dual nationals who were imprisoned in Iran in exchange for five Iranians held in the United States.

;

;Speaking to reporters late on Sunday, senior Biden administration officials said Washington would keep up the pressure on Tehran by imposing fresh sanctions on Iran's ministry of intelligence and former President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad for their involvement in the detention of US citizens. The US had also increased its interdiction posture in the region to deter Iranian arms shipments into Yemen.

;

;Even so, they said the door for diplomacy over Iran's nuclear program was not entirely shut.

;

;"If we see an opportunity, we will explore it but right now, I've really nothing to talk about," the senior administration official said on condition of anonymity.

;

;Asked if there would be any indirect talks with the Iranians this week in New York on the sidelines of the United Nations General Assembly, the official said: "You asked if there's any talks planned this week, absolutely not."

;

;It was unclear if the official meant to deny any indirect talks, or if he was deliberately leaving the door open for them.

;

;After taking office in January 2021, US President Joe Biden tried to revive the 2015 Iran nuclear deal under which Iran had restricted its nuclear program in return for relief from US, European Union and UN sanctions.

;

;Former US President Donald Trump, a Republican, reneged on that deal in 2018, arguing it was too generous to Tehran, and restored broad US economic sanctions against Iran.

;

;Efforts to revive that deal appeared to die about a year ago, when diplomats say Iran rejected what EU mediators called their final offer. However, earlier this year Washington and Tehran began exploring what analysts describe as "understandings" - which Washington has never acknowledged - to lower tensions over nuclear and other issues.

;

;Under Monday's deal, $6 billion in Iranian funds previously held in a restricted account in South Korea had been moved to a restricted account in Qatar, where they would be available for "very limited" humanitarian transactions, the official said.

;

;He listed these categories as food, medicine, medical devices and agricultural products.

;

;"If Iran tries to divert the funds, or use them for anything other than the limited humanitarian purposes authorized, we'll take action to lock up the funds," the official said.

;

;Under the agreement, five Iranians will receive clemency, the officials said. Two of the five had been in prison and their sentences were about to expire, while three others were awaiting trial and had not been convicted.

;

;One of the officials anticipated that two of the Iranians who do not have legal status in the United States would return to Iran through Doha.
